reviews.review_msg: Great prof!! Funny, approachable, and down to earth. Made a 3-hour Monday night lecture informative and enjoyable.
great prof def take him if you can

His lecture slides are not the clearest thing to study from. Definitely go to the lectures and take notes or you'll be kicking yourself come final's time.  Very content heavy but interesting material.

Great professor! He is young, funny, relevant, and (for the ladies) good looking. On the surface the class seems very easy because of the material, but his marking scheme is very specific. The key is memorization. Use your textbook! He repeats a lot of information. Attend lectures, he doesn't post notes and they are very useful. I got an A.

Extremely funny, informative lectures, and very clear what he wants. Exams are a bit tough, and this is no "easy-A" class (busted my ass for an A-). However, if one is a good student, should have no problem getting a reflective grade. As a guy, I can safely say I enjoyed the class despite all the girls who adored him. Take it for a great class!

Martin is wonderful. He is very understanding of his students needs and tries to relax through his french canadian humour. His midterm required a lot of memorization and his final was a mix of memorization and mostly applying your knowledge. Super hot quebecois <3
He is gorgeous and funny. The class is interesting because he is able to bring his humour into the lectures.
He's so hot! OMGZ he has the cutest accent and has cute funny/sarcastic jokes. He makes the class SO interesting and he is just overall awesome prof! HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!
This class is my favorite and plus hes soo hot. His french accent is so cute. He makes the class alot more interesting with his little jokes.
He is very easy to look at, and I always wanted to sit near the front of the class.  He is very energetic, and clear in what he expects.  I'd hit it.

he was a very easy teacher. he had a french accent but he was so pretty to look at that you just wouldnt want to miss his lecture. overall it was my first semester and i would say he was a easy prof and one of the best ones i had. he told you exactly wat to study for midterms and the final and wat he said was on it. BEST TEACHER TO HAVE!!

Amanda was a very good professor for a first year course. Her lectures were straight forward and kept the students engaged, as the slides were open-ended and required additional notes. The tests were a difficult at times, but the online component of the course provided easy marks.
Very good at teaching and is very clear. Exams are pretty easy as long as you read the textbook!

Amanda is an awesome professor in the sense that she is very approachable and helps students with enthusiasm. Take advantage of this and ask for help if you need it, she gives clear interactions and you can even get her to clarify exam questions during the exam. The grade breakdown is great, bc if you can still do well if u mess up on 1 component.
For a first year university class, Amanda was a pretty good prof. However, be warned about her exams. Her exams can be a little tough with the short answers and essay questions.
She was good my name is william and i approve my own message. xD
Very clear. Great guest speakers, and EASY TESTS! Study the powerpoints and you'll do well. Short paper in tutorial.

Sarah was a very thoughtful prof, I took Crim 131 in person with her in fall 2019. Her lectures were never short of engaging and she spent a lot of time focussing on current issues which I thought was wonderful. I found the exams for this class to be a bit long and overwhelming, but I otherwise had few problems. she made an 8:30 am class worth it!

Professor that really cares about her students & their success. Had 3h lectures for this course but she always made it interesting and engaging. Encouraged students to speak to one another and discuss topics to help add variety to learning. Made some great friends in this class. Course work exams and assignments are very fair.

Dr. Danielle Murdoch is the best prof I've ever had at SFU so far. She is super sweet and caring for her students. She wants everyone to achieve. I love it when she does fun activities in class. Raise your hand to contribute, just because she deserves it! 100% recommended.

I cannot recommend Dr. Murdoch enough, especially if you are a first-year student! She is such a kind and inspirational human with loads of knowledge. Grading criteria were clear and exams were the right amount of challenging. The only prof I have had that actually enjoys teaching and helping her students - she has teaching awards to prove it!
LOVED Dr. Murdoch! Best crim prof I've ever encountered. If you're debating taking this class with her, DO IT-- you won't regret it!
best prof i ever had in uni....

Dr. Murdoch is one of the best profs I have ever experienced. They are extremely caring towards their students and their lectures are informative, engaging, and clear. If you've never taken a crim class before but are curious about the subject, absolutely take this class!

Dr. Murdoch is an amazing professor and it is clear she cares about her students. She creates a welcoming environment and gets students to engage in the lectures which makes understanding so much easier. Lovely class lovely lady 10/10 recommend her

Dr. Murdoch is an amazing professor and how all undergrad profs should be!!! She is clear and thorough, and emphasizes equality, equity, and inclusivity. She makes her students feel heard and is open to feedback. Very accommodating and thoughtful. Textbook must be purchased through Top Hat website in order to access the mandatory reading quizzes.

Honestly, she is the best Criminology prof I've ever had (and overall just one of the best profs I've had) - I took her CRIM 131 years ago, and she was very passionate about what she taught. I highly encourage people to take at least one course with her if you can. There is a lot of memorization and work, but her attitude makes the class enjoyable!

This professor is amazing and such an interactive and insightful class to take! Dr. Murdoch is thoughtful, quite a lot of readings per week, approx 40 pages from 2 different textbooks - one for the class and one for the tutorial quizzes. Assignments are super clear, you talk about socially relevant issues, midterms and finals are straightforward.

I love Dr.Murdoch! She is so caring and explains the concepts in a way which is easy to comprehend. Her exams were really fair and you will have an idea of which major concepts will be on the exams. I had Abby as a TA and she is the best TA I've ever had! Quizzes are easy and online. Keep up with the lectures and readings and you will be good.

Dr. Murdoch is very kind and understanding, however in CRIM131 she has two textbooks. One is for exams/lectures and the other one is for weekly quizzes which you have to read on your own and her quiz questions have very similar worded options and is very hard. I do not recommend.

I am happy I chose Dr. M's class. She is very inclusive and makes the lectures very interesting. the guest speaker are a cherry on top! The TA's were good as well. If you go to her student hours for help, she will guide you the best she can. I wish the weekly quizzes had the chapters from what they taught and not the the reader, otherwise great!!

Dr. Murdoch is an amazing professor! She is caring and understanding. The TA's are nice too! There are weekly quizzes and lectures are easy to understand. But, the exams require lots of studying, you have to memorize EVERYTHING from the lecture notes & ALL the key terms. The paper is easy and the rubric is clear. Great professor, highly recommend!!
amazing prof. she really does care about student's wellbeings and very accommodating and kind.
I loved dr. Murdoch, she really cares about her students and really knows her stuff. her lectures are really clear and easy to follow. if you have the chance def take her class!! <3

Clearly very passionate about the things that were discussed during lecture and a fair grader. She was very accessible outside of class and cared for her students and always ready to answer questions.

Her lecture slides are amazing, her teaching style makes content interesting, she's so approachable, and so nice. Her exams came from her lectures and from the textbook, so as long as you study with both, you're good. Her guidelines are so clear and her marking is fair. Would definitely love to have her as my prof again.
Best prof at SFU. Super caring and wants to see her students do well, would highly recommend her. Her exams are average, doesn't post lecture slides online so its important to show up.

She is very helpful and does her best to stimulate class discussions during lecture. She also brings in guest lecturers to better explain the job of correction professions. Exam outlines are provided the week before the exam to help with studying. Exams are a combination of mc, t/f, and sa.
Very interesting instructor. She's very involved in the subject and brings in numerous guest speakers to make the subject matter more interesting & relevant. I'd take another class with her for sure.
A real life Barbie in the Crim Department. Very passionate about teaching, approachable and helpful. PowerPoint delivery of course materials, informative. Grades are fair, exams are reasonable.

From Day 1, Karmvir was caring and ensured us that the online semester will be fine. She clearly cares about her students and replies to emails quickly. After the semester was over, she told us to feel free to contact her with any questions or help. I highly recommend others to keep her as a TA.

Honestly her class is straight forward and she does set you up to succeed by providing guidance for her courses. However, she is very rude & passive; she yelled and got angry at us about another one of her classes cheating on their midterm. Also slightly creepy towards male students.

Farzana is a really enjoyable professor. Lectures do run longer, but she explains everything thoroughly and makes sure we have a proper understanding. Available for questions often, even during lecture. I don't like that she sometimes runs out of time at the end of a lecture and has to rush. Overall good prof.
He is humorous and nice so i liked him. His lectures are based on the textbook and also found midterm fair. But the problem was Final...very difficult and seemed irrelevant from what we learned.

His lectures are straight from the book. He adds in extra stories from his time in the police force, which makes the lecture interesting but irrelevant. He goes through the slides really fast, so you don't get time to copy. The tutorials are great though; it allows for a lot of interesting discussions. His 20 pg journal assignment is over-the-top.

Funny and interesting prof. Very straightforward, with effort, this class can be very easy. Made a boring subject like the CJS interesting. Must pay attention to his lectures and not his PPT, read from the textbook and you should be good to go on the MT and finals. Journals are quite tedious, but simple. Overall, I recommend Rick for CRIM 131

Class is easy. Prof seems easy going and the marking of the class is pretty basic. Midterm and final worth 30% each, 15% for journals, 15% for presentation in tutorial and 10% participation. Here's the kick, there's no notes available, prof says you're doing well don't worry....you should worry. Marking scale is messed up.

He is a funny guy but his marking schemes are something else. His lectures are very clear but his exams themselves are overly tricky. He says no one will fail his class but the midterm median was 18/30 and he didn't scale. The final was just as bad and a lot of people did very badly and he had no intentions to scale. (We can't all be that stupid)

This guy's a strate up G!!! the funnest prof ever... made otherwise lame material enjoyable to learn.... really recommend him.... but a word of advice: really pay attention to wut he says and not as much as to wuts on the ppt, the ppt is all from the book and he uses the crap he says between jokes on exams

Super easy GPA booster. Didn't go to a single lecture and still passed with an A. He will tell you exactly which questions will be on midterm and final which are super easy short answer questions. Essay is worth a lot so get started on it early and you will be fine. Chill class.

I dont think he's “awful” but he's definitely not great either. Lectures were imposible to understand because of his accent, it got so bad that by the third week it was almost an empty lecture hall. There was no tutorial so it made it harder to actually learn something. Tests were very easy but the term paper worth 35% had no clear grading criteria

grading criteria for exams and term paper were very unclear. lectures were 3hrs of rambling nonsense (has a thick accent so very hard to understand), would skip slides and go off on tangents frequently. the material was not focused on Canada's justice system which the course was supposed to be about, overall i learned everything from the textbook

There were 2 in-class assignments, for which he provided the prompts beforehand. Other than that, I rarely attended class due to his heavy accent and tendency to get sidetracked. He posts a comprehensive list of questions for both tests. Overall, the course is manageable without attending lectures as long as you review the slides and readings.

HOW IS HE STILL HIRED BY SFU

Starts side tracking wayyy tooo much during lectures. The only good thing I could say about his class is that all of his exam questions are given earlier from a list of questions beforehand.

He has a strong Russian accent, so beware. However, his exams are quite easy as he provides a list of questions which he pulls exam questions out of. His instructions aren't clear for assignments. His papers  are long so give yourself enough time to write it, proofread it etc.

-Is sweet guy 
-He has a really thick accent
-He provides a link on Canvas to a list of questions that relate to the lecture find the answers to those questions and read the textbook don't have to attend the lectures
-The questions compiled into a list of questions that he uses for the mid-term and finals 
-He only does one big paper for the course

A kind but rambling prof. Rarely gets through all the slides because he goes off topic, so get ready to review by yourself. Do the practice Qs, the exam Qs are pulled from them. Entertaining anecdotes and a good sense of humour. Paper guidelines are vague, but he grades fairly. If you're hard of hearing or can't understand a Russian accent, beware.

Not a bad professor, but is hard to understand because of the accent. Gives you a list of questions from the textbook & selects a few to be on the midterm + final. Read the textbook, study the questions provided & there should be no reason you can't do well. Term paper is minimum 10 pages which is reasonable and should be expected in Crim.

Honestly it's been like 11 weeks since the semester started, I have no clue if he is good and only cause I do not understand single thing that he says. Also his big paper of the class kind of has inconsistent criteria, the doc given to us for it says 10-12 pages but the syllabus that he "updated" says 8-10 so I have no clue what is real or not:(

His accent is very hard to understand, but all his exam questions come from the Textbook learning objectives. He provides a list of all the exam questions beforehand, so you will have plenty of time to memorize the questions. From that list, he will choose about 10-11 questions. It's extremely easy to do well in this class. Just read the textbook.

First year crim major, he's a cool guy but his accent makes it extremely difficult to understand. He starts talking about random things and it's easy to get lost. He gives out practice questions that are based on lectures, videos and textbooks so as long as you do them and memorize it the midterm is really easy.

Great guy! Hard to understand and often goes off topic, but his lessons are straight forward and he provides a question bank before the exam and he selects of a number of those and tests you on it. Long paper but broad topics. Not really necessary to go to class, just do the readings/watch the videos provided as they'll set you up for the exams.
The professor talks about the Russian legal system in a Canadian legal system course. Such a joke. His accent is indecipherable and talks far too quietly.
Probably the worst prof SFU has to offer. You cannot understand a word he says. Syllabus is out-of-date. He does not respond to emails and without a TA you're basically doomed.
Heavy accent, bad slides, quiet and super hard to follow even if you are listening to him like super hard

He was very difficult to understand in lecture (strong accent, would pace around, spoke quietly), and he jumped around topics in the lecture, making it hard to follow. Lectures aren't mandatory - just read the chapter and keep up on the textbook questions because he chooses from a question bank given beforehand for exams). Long paper, start early.

Nice (but yappy) professor, test heavy but pretty easy.

His lectures are 90% him talking about random things, he doesn't finish his thoughts and can be hard to understand. His testing is all based on the practice question he supplies. Attendance is not necessary, but reading the textbook and watching the videos/extra sources he posts are.

Hard to understand because of his accent, but lectures were pretty much copy & paste from the textbook. Do the weekly questions he posts as these will literally be your exams (any of them are fair game) & are easy enough to memorize. Exams are 30% each, Paper 30% (8-14 pages, but broad enough topic that it wasn't hard) & Tutorials 10%. Easy enough.

Pretty good prof, midterm and final consisted of 11 short answer questions, but he gives out all the questions beforehand, you just have to memorize them. No point in showing up for lectures, just make sure to complete the questions each week. Paper was pretty long (10-17 pages), but pretty manageable.

The lectures often took a turn to another subject and his accent made the content hard to follow. He is very nice to talk to, but the in-person exams stressed me out and I often had to teach myself about the subject. The paper criteria was very confusing and he took a long time to release the exam dates.

Participation in tutorials is worth a lot and marks on tests/papers depend on how lenient your TA is. I liked how he basically gave you all of the questions on the exam; its just a matter of memorization. His accent can be hard to understand but honestly just answering the question list can get you an A-B. Beware of the 10-page paper, start early!!

Took his Crim 131 class back in Spring 2020. His exams are quite easy if you study his lecture slides. Didn't really use the textbook at all for it. Paper is easy to do, just follow his guidelines for it and ask questions to your TA or him if necessary. All in all a solid and kind prof. Would recommend.

His lectures are kind of pointless to attend since he posts everything, and it can be hard to understand him at times. Do the readings, go to tutorials and participate, follow the criteria for all assignments and ask questions, and you will be fine.
Just read the textbook. The exam questions are all picked from a list he gives beforehand, so it's super easy to do well.

Nikolay was fine but I would not take him again. He goes off topic all the time so you don't really know what to pay attention too. Going to lecture was definitely not important, it was mostly just textbook readings and paper. He takes questions from the first chapter's learning goals so study those and you'll ace the tests.

This class was very enjoyable, he was very clear of what would be on the exams. He lets you pick a topic for the term paper with no guidelines of what he wants it to be on. His accent can be hard to understand but I do recommend this class.

I loved Professor Shchitov. I took his class Spring 2020 so everything was moved online halfway through, and he was really understanding. There was 1 paper due at the very end that we got in the first week, so we had the whole semester to do it. He also gives a complete question list for the midterm&final, so evrything is laid out 4 you. Great guy.

I'm not going to jump on the band-wagon here. Colleen can teach a class. She is warm, humorous and can engage a classroom. She really cares about education and adapts character to her class. Academic honesty and hard work is the only way to success, so suck it up and read. Colleen makes a fun class and provides content you'll never forget.

Had horrible lecture notes. You definitely have to buy the textbook because studying off of the lecture slides will not be enough for the exams. The online portion of the class was stupid and time wasting because it wasn't even exam-able.

I really enjoyed Colleen's class. My only complaint is that she was a little disorganized at times. She is very nice and is there to help you if you need it. It is important that you do the readings in the textbook as well as follow along in lecture, as material from both will show up on the exam. With a little effort you can do well in her class.

Probably the worst prof I've ever had. She's disorganized, doesn't know the answer to any questions asked, does not review any material, her tests do not reflect any of the material in the textbook or her pathetic notes.  PLEASE avoid her. Do yourself and you GPA a favour and avoid this prof like the plague.

Aynsley is amazing. She gives students everything they need to know in order to be successful. she holds brief lectures before every big assignment/test and records/uploads every other lecture. so easy to approach and soso kind. definitely take her :)

Aynsley is amazing! I go to douglas and shes my prof rn, the sem has barely started and shes already the sweetest prof I've had. she cares deeply about her students doing well and the material is quite easy. she has a very kind heart, all good things to say :) definitely take a class with her, you wont regret it!

Really good lecturer. Her exams (non-cumulative) are very fair if you took decent notes and read the main textbook. She doesn't post her slides but she does post video lectures. The second textbook was kind of dumb (not tested other than in online quizzes and discussed in tutorial), but other than that, it was a really good / easy class.

A bad class. Gives to much info when she talks. Goes off topic in lecture but tests on that stuff not mandatory book or slides she shows but refuses to give copies of. It was like a cross web class with online quizzes from a useless second expensive book that she didn't use besides quizzes not even on exams but still had lectures and tutorials.
Hardest prof I've had at SFU. Tough grading, boring assignments, and not a helpful prof. Also tells jokes that she thinks are funny and tries to be relatable, but is actually rude IMO.

She's really great. Amazing lectures and online modules are pretty easy except when it comes to the tests. They were straightforward but the TA's marked pretty hard. Like ridiculously hard. Overall, the prof is great and would recommend if you don't want to be bored out of your mind. Remember to write notes because she doesn't post them up.
she's the reason why i even made an account. as long as you listen and write down good notes then you'll be fine!! if you're not into law then don't take it
Phenomenal professor. So kind and funny. Test questions are straight from the lecture  slides but she does not post these slides online. Easy A if you show up to class.

I really enjoyed the class! You have to work though, she doesn't post her notes and her exams have written portions that you need to study for. The lectures are great! The online module quizzes, don't forget to watch your deadlines
Tough course, but such a sweet teacher who really wants to help you.

Aynsley is nice and really helpful! The exams weren't too easy, but they're manageable (go to lectures!). The online tutorials were fairly easy marks, so do the tutorial readings even though they won't be tested on exams. Lectures were interesting and she'll occasionally pause for question-taking to make sure everyone's clear and on the same page.

Not the easiest of professors but honestly the best professor I have ever met. What made her stand out was how engaging and energetic she was teaching the class. She is very positively responsive to participation and discussion (it's also mandatory), which is necessary because her slides can be a bit dry.

Awesome prof. She is very nice and always willing  to help. She is very clear about her expectations and encourages the success of her students. Lectures are great overall except she doesn't post the lecture slides online which sucks but it's for your own good. Exams and marking are fair, just need to attend class and do the readings.
Aynsley is amazing! By far the best prof Ive had so far at SFU. She was a wonderful lecturer, however her exams were on the tough side. Definitely recommend!

Aynsley is a nice prof and clear when speaking and instructing. She could improve on her powerpoints. She doesn't post them online so you need to be there to take them but they're very vague. Ofc adlib your notes but you can't catch everything bc she lacks an engaging presence or way of presenting the material. BUT final not cumulative!

Her lectures were amazing! Easy to follow, summarizes the main ideas and she encourages questions and discussions during them. Do not hesitate to ask her questions as she is always willing to help. Her midterm was fair; if you read through the stuff she mentioned during review, you should get an A+ no problem. She's the best prof I have ever had.

Aynsley is a great prof, she's always welcoming questions for clarification. She encourages us to use office hours. She doesn't post slides online because she says students learn better by taking their own notes, so always attend lectures. Had some interesting guest speakers this term, she's definitely a prof I'd love to have again.

I have had a terrible time in this course. I've had trouble with the syllabus not matching up with the materials online. I completed an assignment on time, only to be told 2 days later by the TA that I had done it all wrong, and should refer to my syllabus (where it said nothing about this particular assignment). I'm not impressed.
She is by far the best prof I have ever had.. She made going to class so worth it and reminded me of why I am majoring in Criminology. AMAZING!

The reason why I created an account here in the first place. Definitely the best prof I have ever known. Exams and papers are definitive in their marking and more concept focused than route memorization. She makes questions and comments warmly encouraged during class and gives her all to see students do well. Couldn't ask for anything more.
BEST PROF EVER! TAKE ANY CRIM CLASS WITH HER. SHE WANTS YOU TO DO WELL
One of my favourite profs at SFU. Extremely kind, helpful, and approachable. Exams are fair. Term paper was fair. Would definitely recommend.
i took the course last year and it was the best crim course. Tests are really fair; all questions are directly from lec. notes and textbook.
Came to Yerchich's Intro class to give a lecture on policing. Murphy's great; interesting and lively. Def gonna try to get a class with him.
Really puts the BIG in big sarge. When I grow up, I wanna be a cop just like him.
kinda hot lowkey
McConnell was an OG street goon back in his days with the VPD, and now I had the pleasure to see the big sarge that he's become. Free my boy McConnell, I lowkey wouldn't mind if he slides in my dms.
They packed his ahh up 😭
Professor lost his job because his slid dm's into classmates and made advances that were not professional.

Just so good. if you can take his class just do it. He is responsible for teaching students, lecture is fun, grades fairly, provide instruction for every module, and overall very organized. The weekly module quiz is kinda lengthy and time-consuming but still worth taking his course

Easy assignments, fun to do and still teach you a lot. His lectures are great as his connections to his career as a police officer offer an intriguing perspective you won't see in many profs. Keiron is an effervescent and intelligent prof. His lectures are full of substance but he teaches in a way that actually sticks with you. Take this class!!!!!

Dr. McConnell is my favourite professor so far. He tells funny stories to connect to lecture topics. He's understanding of students course loads so is very easy going with deadlines. Would take again in a heart beat!

BEST teacher I have had at SFU. Easy going, jokes around, his tests are always the same format and if you know your notes inside out, there won't be any surprises. Careful with the TA's, you migh not get so lucky. I had one that kept ranting on about one thing she happens to be talking about and wouldn't shut up. She was just... blegh. Ruined tuts.

Very knowledgeable about the content, seems to enjoy teaching the material. The only problem was she would sometimes go slow and go into detail on certain slides then go fast and students wouldn't have time to write what the slide had up. She doesn't send out slides so if you are a slow writer you may sometimes be affected by this.

She  says "um" and "uhh" a lot and phrases sentences weird ways; stumbles over her words which makes it soo hard to follow her lectures and makes you feel like you need the whole textbook to understand the topics.  However, she's knowledgeable and knows the topics.

Average prof. Very fair tests. She does not provide lecture notes because she wants you to learn by writing things down. She had three guest speakers which used up 3 lectures. One of the TA's taught two of the lectures. Lectures by her can be painful to listen to because she does not speak fluidly and it becomes obvious once you notice.
Had her as my TA for CRIM 131 with Sheri Fabian. I ended up with a A-. Very fair marker and helpful if you need her help

she is very rude and way too hard of a marker, and gets visibly irritated when first years don't know everything "like her". don't ask her for help because she won't provide much help and will be rude.

He is a really clear prof. He knows what he is talking about since he was a cop himself. His journals are easy too he expects them to be thoughtful and actually wants to know your opinion. His exams are easy if you study since he tells you exactly what is going to be on them. I only used the book when I was reviewing for the midterm and the exam.

Kash is a very engaging lecturer and makes the course much more interesting than it actually is. He marks his exams pretty easily. The only thing I have againt him is that he tends to push his opinion onto you and scoffs at opinions that are different from his. Would reconmend people to take this class with him.
amazing teacher!! he is so interesting and is the only prof i feel ive ever learned something from. plus hes hot!

VERY EASY PROF!! His midterms and finals are very easy since he tells you every single question that's going to be on the exams. His class were kind of boring though. Many times, he would go off topic, but I would def. take a course with him again just because he is so easy

Attending his class was only for pure interest. He'll interest you. When he says "don't worry about the midterm"...he actually means it. As in, if you never read the book but ATTENDED the lecture for the review of the midterm. You WILL gain at least a low A in the midterm/final.
I love her. She is the best prof at SFU so far. She is so respectful, caring and compassionate about teaching. I would take every class with her as I can she is really one of a kind professor.

I love her! Dr Fennig is sooo sweet and caring. Very good for first year, she's extremely clear about what she wants and teaches you how to work in university overall instead of just in her class. She cares about you mental health and is so genuine. Just do the readings, pay attention and take good notes.

Dr. Fennig is a great prof for CRIM 131! Very kind and wants everyone to succeed. Tutorial presentation is easy to do well on, and make sure to start the final paper early. Only downside is the very specific questions on the midterm. Just take lots of notes during lectures on what she and guest speakers say and you can do well.

Dr. Fennig is really passionate about what she teaches and always tries to make everyone in the class participate and learn something which is really appreciated during online schooling. Shes tough on making sure you do your assignments but only because she wants you to pass. Her class was awesome and Id definitely love to have her again.

Dr Fennig is very kind and clear in her teaching. She gave lots of time for the quizzes and midterm. The only issue was that there were discrepancies between the instructions her and the TAs gave- the TA will mark your paper, and my TA made several mistakes on mine. Start the term paper early!

Dr. Fennig deeply cares about her students and focuses on the mental health aspect from day 1. Her tests and quizzes are fair. During her lectures, she would occasionally bring in guest speakers to provide insight on the topic we were learning for that week. I would definitely take her class again and recommend others to as well.

Dr. Fennig was by far one of my favourite professors at SFU. She truly showed me how to be successful in all my courses. I appreciate the lengths and measures she took to teach Crim 131. The course itself would not have been as phenomenal if it wasnt for Dr. Fennigs teaching methods. Definitely take a course with her if you have the chance to!

Tamie is so caring and wants her students to do well, however she does expect that you put in the effort to succeed. She asks questions on tests about very specific things from the readings/lecture (statistics especially) and does focus on memorization more than general concepts. The readings are definitely essential to doing well.

Really nice & caring person but expects a lot from you for exams etc. in order to do GOOD let alone great on the exams you have to have memorized every reading ever given from both textbooks + articles. TA's were nice but felt as if Korrie didnt want you to do well from how hard she was- harder than the prof herself. over all loved Tamies lecturing

The best professor at SFU, she is honestly so caring and wants her students to succeed. As long as you do the readings and pay attention in lecture, you will be fine. Highly recommend visiting her during office hours as she is very accessible outside of class. If you ever have the chance to take a course with Tamie, do so because she's the best!

She definitely cares about her students success, class is fairly lecture heavy but she has good slides and doesn't rush. Lots of reading, id stay 40-50 pages a week sometimes more. Overall kinda boring class but definitely not the worst.

Dr. Fennig is genuinely a caring professor who wants to see the best in all of her students. But, she is a very TOUGH marker. You have to memorize the readings and her lecture notes word for word in order to do well on the midterm and final exams. Participation matters in tutorials where you will also be preparing a presentation thats worth a lot.

I thought Sarah was an amazing professor. It was an 8:30 am lec and I actually enjoyed waking up to go to her lectures. It's obvious that she really cares for her students and knows her stuff. I thought the exams were ok, but I def think there were better, more relevant terms she could have chosen for the final this semester. Otherwise, a gem.

I really enjoyed this class! Sarah gave great notes, posted the slides and she said she recorded her lectures, but I never did check on that because I just showed up to class. She keeps the lectures pretty entertaining and gives very specific hints to what will be on the midterm and final. Her exams were very fair and straightforward!

Sarah is an amazing prof and I would love to take her again! Crim 131 was very enjoyable. She posts her lectures online, but showing up to her class is worth it as her lectures are very interesting and engaging. As for tests, her short answer questions are very specific so make sure you read the text and study hard.

-exams are very detail oriented, cant miss a single detail or you wont do good. -Lots of reading -TAs are a hit and miss in this class, make sure you have one that actually enjoys their job and cares about their students. -Good lectures -Tutorials were a mess and not informative or helpful at all.

Sarah is a okay prof and will literally tell you a couple of questions that are going to be on the exam. But her exams are truly 50% lecture and 50% textbook. So make sure to make good notes on all of the readings, as she will bring out random points and put them on the exam. To add on, I personally found her final easier than the midterm.

Although I didn't so as well as I hoped to in this class, I loved it! She is such an amazing, funny, and educated prof. She would clearly state "this is going to be on the exam" in the middle of lecture.. so make sure you attend/pay attention. I hope to take another class with her in the future, would totally recommend. :)

Sarah is superb. Best crim prof at SFU. Honest, caring, intelligent and a dynamic lecturer. Take a class with her if you can because you won't regret it. She makes even dull topics really interesting. Also very open about what will be on the exam and how to write the paper because she wants her students to succeed.

I love Sarah and she is one of my favorite prof in SFU! She is fun, compassionate and exceptional speaker. The instructions for the assignments are super clear. As long as you follow the guidance you will do great. All the TAs are super helpful and kind. Study the slides for short answer questions and read the textbook for MC questions.

Super awesome crim prof! She wants to see her students succeed and do well. She basically tells you possible exam questions and ideas for your term paper and project. Lectures are interesting even though the course itself is a bit boring she makes it interesting. She can manage to hold my attention for the entire two hours of lecture!

Sarah is a very kind prof and is quite relatable and seems like she has a genuine passion for the field. Don't mistake her kind/sweet personality for being not strict. She still boosted the class average quite a bit since it was SO LOW! She tells you what is going to be on the exam but her exams are very word per word definition based.

Sarah is an amazing prof. Take any class with her. For reals. She is super informative, approachable, and willing to help. She does take all info from her lectures, tutorials and text from my experience but she isn't unreasonable for what she expects you to know.
Amazing prof! Patient and knowledgeable on the subject matter. Suggest you take her if you get the chance!

Sarah was the best profs I hav ever had. She was kind and patient with all of my questions. I had a tougher time with this class then I thout I would but her understanding helpes me succed. Gave the entire class a grad bump and. She was always accessible. Her lectures were entertaining and engaging, wel thout out and funy.

She is a really sweet prof who wanted the best for her students. If the exam mark was low, she gave us a bump and even an incentive for the final exam to result in higher grades. Exam basically is based off the textbook. Fair marker, the TAs are a bit hard to reach. Other than that, would definetly reccomend.

Sarah is an amazing prof, she really cares about making sure her students succeed in her class. She gave my entire class an 8% bump up on the midterm as she felt the average was lower than she wanted, and went through each exam question by question to ensure she hadn't made bad questions. She is incredibly kind and willing to answer any questions.
Firm but fair and kind.

I loved taking a class with Yercich! I'm waiting for more classes taught by her to fit my schedule. I enjoy the way she introduces content and makes it more interesting. Her exams are really fair as long as you keep up with the material and it's evident that she wants you to succeed in her class because she's always available for help.

Yercich's the best!! Take a class from her if you can. Good lecturer, clear, smart & empathetic. Understands her students & what they need. Makes learning fun, even for boring intro level classes. Not a crim student but would take more classes with yercich if I could.

She's an amazing prof, she tries her best to make a few jokes here and there during lectures, but her attempts are funnier than her actual jokes. She's very clear on what she expects from the students and gives a concise outline of the midterm and final exam. Really enjoyed taking her class and will definitely take another with her.

Great class & lectures & fair grading. She & the TA are both great, helpful & friendly; they have a cute dynamic. Would take Sarah & Walter again. Only downside are e-tutorials (boring & pointless), but etutorials come with the class not the prof. You're stuck with the etutorials no matter who you take the class with.

Sarah is very kind and approachable. She also replies her email quickly if you have any questions. The class is not easy, but if you put in the work, you'll do well! She also reasonable when it comes to due dates and assignments, and gives students a chance to improve their grades. High recommend!

really awesome prof, just takes a few classes to "adjust" to her personality. lectures were great, so reasonable on deadlines and giving students ways to bump up their grades. Super straight forward exams, would recommend for any crim courses she teaches!! one of my fav profs thus far. no complaints!

She's great. 131 could be boring but Sara goes out of her way to make lecture fun and entertaining. She's also got a really good, positive upbeat energy and is very kind and genuine with students. One of a kind IMO. Will take more classes with her. Tests are fair. Paper was okay but fair. Online tutorials are boring but easy. Sara makes the class.

The class is okay but boring subject. Might be more interesting for crime students. The etutorials are okay 2 but also boring and you need to buy the book. The prof is great tho. She's the reason I enjoyed the class.

Lectures were long, but kind of essential to passing since she did not give notes, but you could listen to the lecture online. Reading the textbook is also essential to passing exams. Sarah was always available to help even when she said she would not be able to check her email she did.

Amazing prof. She is more than willing to help you out whether its in person or email. She honestly goes above the call of duty when she helps you. Lectures arent the most entertaining but shes a great lecturer. Awesome teacher, definitely recommend taking any class with her. Thanks Sarah for a great first semester.

Sarah is an extremely understanding prof. She's very approachable; super nice and helpful. Asks questions during lectures, and makes a good effort to answering our questions as well. Lots of reading to do, the textbook is a must. Overall, easy class, just make sure you don't fall behind; study and do the work.

Open book quizzes were easy and the presentation was fairly easy as well. As for the midterm, paper and final.. super hard! no direction of what's going to be on there and almost all of the class did horribly on the midterm so horrible that she sent out an email explaining that everyone did horribly. However at the end she does slightly scale up.
The feedback for the mid term was excellent. Very constructive and detailed. All inquiries responded to, very pleased.
tutorials were mostly group based, powerpoint were lacking information, get ready for reading the textbook

Dawn is a good prof and made 8:30am class more interesting. Textbooks and lectures are important. The term paper was alright. I found the short answer not as fair for the exams. TA's will be huge in this class. Krystina was AMAZING and so understanding. TRY AND GET HER IF POSSIBLE. Show up and try and you will be fine.

Dawn was an amazing prof. She made the lecture so engaging and was ready to explain anything you don't understand. Her exams are MC and short answers, textbook and lecture-based. I found that the MC was easier but the short answer was hard and unfair. TA will make or break grade. The term paper is difficult but doable. Spent 6h in court for it. rip

the midterm and final were extremely difficult. the mc portion was alright but the written responses were hard because it covered a broad range of topics. was told we didn't need to memorize anything from the charter of rights by the TA but turns out we did so...

TA's will make or break your grade!
An awesome semester :) Loved the class and everything about it!

Trash instructor that should have stayed in Alberta. Unclear assignments, unclear grading. Does not grade fairly. Will ask for a review of her before providing graded assignments which is not fair. Unwilling to accommodate. On the other side, the TA, Krystina was great, the instructor however, is awful.
